Name: Compressarr
Overview:
Compressarr is an application to take a filtered set of media from Radarr or (eventually) Sonarr and process it with customisable FFmpeg presets. It will even attempt to find the best settings for each video.
	The default version is the Alpine version supporting limited Intel hardware support. For Nvidia Cuda encoding use the Nvidia (tag) version which is 1.4GB using the Ubuntu Core.

Branch.TagDescription: This is the Standard build, limited QSV hardware support, built to be small and light
This is the NVidia Ubuntu build, full Cuda support, built with the nightly FFmpeg and weighs in at 1.4GB

@attributes.Name: Nvidia Visible Devices
@attributes.Description: Nvidia Visible Devices (Optional - Requires Nvidia GPU and Unraid Nvidia build)

@attributes.Name: Config directory
@attributes.Description: This is where Compressarr will store it's configuration.

@attributes.Name: Media directory
@attributes.Description: This needs to be the same as the root for Radarr/Sonarr. Create more as required

@attributes.Name: Output directory
@attributes.Description: This is an output directory, Radarr/Sonarr needs to see this for importing to work
